title: Georgi Sarmov
text:
Georgi Sarmov (; born 7 September 1985) is a <a href="Bulgaria">Bulgaria</a>n former professional <a href="association%20football">footballer</a> who played as a <a href="central%20midfielder">central midfielder</a>.
Career.
Naftex.
Between 2004 and 2006 Sarmov played for <a href="PFC%20Naftex%20Burgas">Naftex Burgas</a>, making 43 league appearances and scoring 2 goals.
Levski Sofia.
He became a <a href="Bulgarian%20A%20Professional%20Football%20Group%23Champions">Champion of Bulgaria</a> in 2009.
During 2009/2010 season, Levski qualified for <a href="2009%E2%80%9310%20UEFA%20Europa%20League">UEFA Europa League</a> group stage. In 2009/2010 season, Levski achieved qualifying for <a href="2010%E2%80%9311%20UEFA%20Europa%20League">UEFA Europa League</a>, becoming 3rd in the final ranking.
Kasımpaşa S.K..
On 17 May 2010, Sarmov together with his teammate <a href="Nikolay%20Dimitrov%20%28footballer%20born%201987%29">Nikolay Dimitrov</a> signed for <a href="Kas%C4%B1mpa%C5%9Fa%20S.K.">Kasımpaşa S.K.</a> for five years.
Beroe.
In January 2016, Sarmov signed with <a href="PFC%20Beroe%20Stara%20Zagora">Beroe Stara Zagora</a>.
Etar.
On 4 August 2017, Sarmov signed with <a href="SFC%20Etar%20Veliko%20Tarnovo">Etar Veliko Tarnovo</a>.
Chemnitz.
In late April 2019, Sarmov was unveiled as the first signing of <a href="Germany">German</a> club <a href="Chemnitzer%20FC">Chemnitzer FC</a> for the 2019/2020 season.
International career.
He debuted for <a href="Bulgaria%20national%20football%20team">Bulgaria national football team</a> on 26 March 2008 against <a href="Finland%20national%20football%20team">Finland</a>, appearing as a late substitute for <a href="Dimitar%20Berbatov">Dimitar Berbatov</a>. The result of the match was 2:1 with a win for Bulgaria.
